result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary hearing on August 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant in court with Attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Joseph E. Mimier appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
defn's
and retention
signed
Status conference on July 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with J.M.C.
- Defendant shall not leave Dane County without prior approval of BMP (for the purposes of employment only.)
- Defendant shall turn over any passports to the Dane County Clerk of Courts within 24 hours of release from custody.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $500.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $3000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 15

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jason C. Gonzalez.  Tim Helmberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jim Larson, interpreter, appeared. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  
The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
